title: CMPO User Fellow in Public Policy
abstractText: CMPO is the countryâ€™s leading research centre analysing public service reform, producing cutting edge research and disseminating our findings to policy makers and the public. We seek funding to enable us to share our expertise with research users. We wish to appoint a short-term User Fellow in Public Policy. This will clearly increase the rate at which we can transfer knowledge to public policy analysts. The benefits to the User Fellow and her/his organisation are the acquisition of specific analytical tools and spending time in a relevant research organisation.
impactText: The findings on welfare reform were included as part of the discussions within HM Treasury on welfare reform Communities and Social Services/Policy,Government, Democracy and Justice Policy & public services
findingsText: This grant funded the secondment of a researcher from HM Treasury to spend time at CMPO working with Prof Paul Gregg on welfare reform. The research findings form part of the accumulating evidence on the complexities of welfare reform and so are being taken forward in a general sense through those reforms.
